Definition: Policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor organizational requirements
Policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory and legal responsibilities and risks
Social practices and norms in an organization including the customs, arts, social institutions, and achievements. Practices designed to recognize the advantages and accomplishments of sharing data
Practices focused on enabling success in achieving the desired characteristics in employees to meet data management goals
Outreach and interactions among organizations or individuals with shared goals or interests
Hierarchy of authority permitting coordination of individuals and groups
Methods to assess the costs of data over their lifecycle

Activities describing how research data will be managed and documented throughout a project and the terms regarding the subsequent deposit of the data with a data repository for long-term management and preservation
The ‘things’ that matter most to an organization, e.g., are logged in transactions, reported on, measured, analyzed
Data and data that define characteristics of other data such as source, type, or other information that helps to contextualize

Describes the structure of an organization's logical and physical data assets and data management resources. It...comprises the models, policies, rules, and standards that govern the collection, storage, arrangement, integration, and use of data in organizations
Those things that enable the provision of data management and the enforcement of data management policies
Guidelines by which data are described and recorded. They can enable reserach data to be interoperable.
Define success in specific goals or objectives
Outreach and interactions among organizations or individuals

Term: Access Control Associated with Data Sensitivity
Definition: Define what success in data management or in specific goals or objectives means and how success can be measured and controlled
Review of the overall strategies and drivers of an organization’s research data program.
The tactical management positioning in an organization for effective research data management throughout the research data lifecycle.
